body:
### Problem

With `signcolumn=auto` and sign placed via extmark inside decoration provider, sign column might be not visible when it should be.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create the following 'init.lua':
    ```lua
    -- Prepare UI: six windows all displaying same buffer
    local many_lines = {}
    for i = 1, 500 do
      table.insert(many_lines, 'Line #' .. i)
    end
    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(0, 0, -1, false, many_lines)

    vim.cmd('wincmd s | wincmd s | wincmd v | wincmd j | wincmd v | wincmd j | wincmd v')
    vim.schedule(function() vim.cmd('wincmd j') end)

    -- Define helper data
    _G.log, _G.needs_clear = {}, false
    local ns_id, mark_id = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace('test'), nil

    -- Add decoration which possibly clears all extmarks and adds one on line 499
    local on_win = function(_, winid, bufnr, toprow, botrow)
      table.insert(_G.log, { winid, bufnr, toprow, botrow })

      if _G.needs_clear then
        vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(bufnr, ns_id, 0, -1)
        _G.needs_clear = false
      end

      if toprow < 499 and 499 <= botrow then
        mark_id = vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(bufnr, ns_id, 499, 0, { id = mark_id, sign_text = '!', invalidate = true })
      end
    end
    vim.api.nvim_set_decoration_provider(ns_id, { on_win = on_win })
    ```
2. `nvim --clean -u path/to/init.lua`
3. Press `G` to go to last line. Sign `!` appears in current window **but** sign column in other windows does not appear.
4. Press `<C-l>` to redraw the screen - all sign columns appear.
5. Execute `:lua log, needs_clear = {}, true`. Sign column disappears in top two windows but still present in other windows.
6. Execute `:=log` to see that windows which were missing sign columns were processed by decoration provider *before* the one which added extmark.

Here is the demo:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/314312eb-bc78-4eca-b3b3-7d1757b04685

### Expected behavior

Adding sign to a buffer via extmark should result into sign column appearing in all windows displaying that buffer.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1272+g3d3a99e69c

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, doesn't have this functionality

### Operating system/version

EndeavourOS Linux x86_64, 6.12.1-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

Ghostty 0.1.0-main+3c637a27

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

appimage
